sage.scene

Class HUDObject

  • java.lang.Object
    • sage.scene.SceneNode
      • sage.scene.Leaf
        • sage.scene.HUDObject
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    HUDImage, HUDString

    public abstract class HUDObject
extends Leaf
    HUDObject defines a SceneNode which resides on the "HUD" (Heads-Up Display) -- that is, on the screen "in front of" normal Scenegraph (game-world) objects. HUDObjects locations are specified in normalized device coordinate (NDC) space, which runs from (0,0) at the lower left corner to (1,1) at the upper right corner of the output device. The default SceneNode.RENDER_MODE for HUDObjects is SceneNode.RENDER_MODE.ORTHO.
    Author:
    John Clevenger

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      HUDObject()
      Constructs a HUDObject with a default location at the lower left screen corner and a default color as specified by HUDObject(double, double).
      HUDObject(double xLoc, double yLoc)
      Constructs a HUDObject with the specified screen location and a default color of Color.red.
      HUDObject(double xLoc, double yLoc, java.awt.Color c)
      Constructs a HUDObject with the specified location (where location (0,0) is at the lower left and (1,1) is at the upper right) and the specified color.

    • Method Detail

      • getLocation

        public java.awt.geom.Point2D.Double getLocation()
        Returns a Point2D giving the location of this HUDObject. The internal representation of the location is in Double form (that is, the object returned is always of type Point2D.Double).
        Returns:
        this HUDObject's location

      • setLocation

        public void setLocation(java.awt.geom.Point2D.Double newLoc)
        Sets the location of this HUDObject. Note that in order for the HUDObject to be visible the specified location must be between (0,0) and (1,1).
        Parameters:
        newLoc - -- the new location for this HUDObject

      • updateLocalBound

        public void updateLocalBound()
        Description copied from class: Leaf
        updateLocalBound() computes a new local bounding volume for this Leaf by re-examining the vertex data for the leaf. This method is specified by this class (and also by the parent SceneNode class) but must be implemented by any derived classes since the abstract Leaf class can't know what the subclass data looks like (and hence can't know how to compute the bounding volume).
        Specified by:
        updateLocalBound in class Leaf
